title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The sleep-debt-tracker repository is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML, designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. It leverages TypeScript for a robust and maintainable codebase, focusing on providing a simple and intuitive interface for recording sleep patterns and visualizing sleep debt over time. This project showcases practical application of TypeScript principles in a front-end web development context.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project management application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and styled with CSS. It leverages MUI for UI components, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and showcases best practices for building modern web applications with these technologies. The project serves as a learning resource and a foundation for building more complex applications with a focus on a structured and maintainable codebase.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project showcasing interactive map visualizations built using HTML and Python. This repository explores various methods for presenting geographical data in a user-friendly and engaging way, focusing on the core concepts of data visualization and web-based map interfaces.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data storage and styled with HTML and CSS. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of a web application following common software development principles, covering topics such as database interaction, front-end design, and server-side logic, and is deployed using shell scripting.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript to provide a platform for creating and participating in polls and voting systems. This repository contains the source code for a modern and interactive voting application, encompassing features like user authentication, poll creation, real-time vote tracking, and result visualization, falling under the broader project topic.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, built using TeX for professional formatting and potentially incorporating HTML for online display. It's a personal project focused on crafting a clean and effective resume document.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for visualizing and interacting with data from a Robofleet robotics system. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, it offers tools for monitoring robot status, displaying sensor information, and controlling robot behavior, ultimately serving as a central project for managing and understanding Robofleet deployments.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a responsive and interactive dashboard interface built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing modern web development techniques, focusing on creating visually appealing and functional user interfaces.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project repository built using TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [briefly state the core purpose of the project, e.g., "creating a modern UI library" or "developing a backend API for user management"]. It leverages the benefits of TypeScript for type safety and modern JavaScript features for a robust and scalable solution.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log data. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and interpret log messages for efficient debugging and performance analysis within ROS projects. This repository is dedicated to the development and maintenance of this log viewing tool, focusing on enhancing its features and usability.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: dynamic-event-calendar is a project implementing a dynamic and interactive event calendar using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository showcases techniques for creating a responsive and user-friendly calendar interface that can be easily customized and integrated into web applications for displaying and managing event schedules.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS, utilizing Supabase for backend services, to provide a comprehensive solution for managing and tracking IoT assets. This project demonstrates best practices in modern web development while addressing the challenges of real-time asset monitoring and data management.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide engaging conversational AI experiences. This project explores various aspects of building a modern web application, including front-end development with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, back-end development with Node.js, and integration with powerful AI models.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project management tool built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to help users brainstorm, organize, and develop their ideas. It provides a visual and interactive platform for managing projects from conception to completion, focusing on clarity and collaboration.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository houses a web-based project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This project focuses on [**insert specific purpose of the project here, e.g., interactive world map visualization, a dynamic personal portfolio, or a data-driven exploration tool**], leveraging modern web technologies to [**briefly mention the key functionalities, e.g., display real-time information, showcase skills and experience, or analyze geographic data**].

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains a collection of Python-based Jupyter Notebook projects focused on financial analysis and modeling. It utilizes various Python libraries to explore topics such as portfolio optimization, risk management, and time series analysis, providing practical examples and implementations for applying Python to finance.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a fully functional e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the Pages Router), TypeScript, and JavaScript. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and MUI for a modern, responsive user interface. This repository serves as a practical example of a complete e-commerce application, showcasing best practices in type-safe development and modern web technologies.
